nodes.bodyText: We are in a build step. Why don't we inject the configuration object to avoid this sort of issues?

Because that creates a cycle. Vert.x HTTP does the same for the HTTP port.
If we use the configuration, the augmentation fails with:
Caused by: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Run time configuration cannot be consumed here unless the method is a @Recorder at io.quarkus.grpc.runtime.config.GrpcConfiguration conf of public io.quarkus.kubernetes.spi.KubernetesPortBuildItem io.quarkus.grpc.deployment.GrpcServerProcessor.registerGrpcServiceInKubernetes(java.util.List,io.quarkus.grpc.runtime.config.GrpcConfiguration) of class io.quarkus.grpc.deployment.GrpcServerProcessor
Ah yes, forgot about this issue: we are consuming runtime configuration at build time. I withdraw my comment.
